title: The images of the acts against Bolsonaro by Brazil
description: Led by women, mobilizations took place in several capitals. Retired soldier, who left hospital, was supported in minor acts in seven states
text: This Saturday, September 29, Brazil faced the largest street demonstration since the height of the impeachment political crisis in 2016. Responding to a call from women who reject the extreme right candidate, Jair Bolsonaro, hundreds of thousands took to the streets under the slogan #EleNão. The offensive was followed by several social groups and one of the biggest concentration points was Largo da Batata, in São Paulo. The organizers speak of 150,000 people, but the Military Police did not want to estimate the public. MIGUEL SCHINCARIOL (AFP) Vision of the protest on the Salvador waterfront this Saturday, the 29th. Singer Daniela Mercury pulled out an electric mini-trio to support the movement. Woman in São Paulo displays a #EleNão poster. Marcelo Chello (EFE) Another large rally took place in downtown Rio de Janeiro. In the image, demonstrators, with their children, in Cinelândia Square. One of the movement's mottos is the repudiation of misogynistic and inciting rape (for which he is a defendant in the Supreme Federal Court), homophobic or racist phrases (he has already been convicted at a civil level, but the Supreme Court rejected the complaint for racism) .STRINGER (REUTERS) Protestant in Rio. The protest attracted different audiences and, according to the G1 website, took place in the 26 states and the Federal District. Bolsonaro leads the opinion polls with 28% of the intentions to vote for president, followed by Fernando Haddad (PT), with 22%. RICARDO MORAES (REUTERS) In Rio, the demonstrators recalled the death of Mariele Franco, the PSOL councillor executed in March in Rio, a crime still unsolved. RICARDO MORAES (REUTERS) Children with the slogan #elenão in Rio.STRINGER (REUTERS) During the day, there were also acts of Bolsonaro supporters in at least 16 States. The candidate, who was discharged from the hospital after 23 days recovering from a knife attack, traveled to his home in Rio de Janeiro.Pilar OLIVARES (REUTERS) Barbária X Civilization says a sign at the demonstration in São Paulo. REUTERS Women raise their fist in action in Rio. Silvia Izquierdo (AP) It was a purple carnival, the color of feminism. In the photo, a protester with her body painted: #elenão .STRINGER (REUTERS) Protesters in Recife. Marina Rossi Demonstrators in Largo da Batata, in São Paulo, with the sign: “Evangelicals against Bolsonaro”. Marcelo OliveriaAnother poster at the march in São Paulo. Militants from various candidates took the opportunity to make pamphlets and campaign at the event. The only rule was to repudiate the extreme right candidate, Marcelo Oliveira. Women are the majority of the Brazilian electorate and, so far, the most indecisive, so a protest that mobilizes this portion of the population can be decisive. Victor Moriyama (Getty Images) A group also marched against Bolsonaro, the LGBTQ community. Bolsonaro has already made several homophobic statements. Nelson ALMEIDA (AFP) Women protesting in São Paulo. Victor Moriyama (Getty Images) Poster against the extreme right candidate.Nelson ALMEIDA (AFP)

Responding to a call from women who reject the extreme right candidate, Jair Bolsonaro, hundreds of thousands took to the streets under the slogan #EleNão. The offensive was followed by several social groups and one of the biggest concentration points was Largo da Batata, in São Paulo. The organizers speak of 150,000 people, but the Military Police did not want to estimate the public. Miguel SCHINCARIOL (AFP);Protester at the #EleNão event in Rio.

title: Protests against Bolsonaro take place in 26 states and DF; acts in favor, in 16
description: Events have taken place since Saturday morning. In 114 cities, they were against Jair Bolsonaro and in 40, in favor. The biggest demonstrations were in Rio de Janeiro and São Paulo.
text:
! [Protesters take to the streets in 26 states and in the Federal District against the candidate Jair Bolsonaro Protesters take to the streets in 26 states and in the Federal District against the candidate Jair Bolsonaro] (https://s03.video.glbimg.com/x240/7054318.jpg)
Demonstrators take to the streets in 26 states and the Federal District against candidate Jair Bolsonaro
Demonstrators from all states and the Federal District took to the streets in acts against presidential candidate Jair Bolsonaro (PSL) this Saturday (29). The movement, called #EleNão, was launched on social media, with the support of artists, during the month of September. Altogether, there were 114 cities with contrary acts.
In response to the movement, Bolsonaro supporters also gathered at events across Brazil to demonstrate support for the presidential candidate. 40 cities in 16 states held acts in favor of Bolsonaro.
In Rio de Janeiro, demonstrators against the candidate gathered in Cinelândia, in the center, in the early afternoon. Initially, the rally was in front of the Cine Odeon.
At 17:00, some of the demonstrators left Cinelândia and marched through the streets of downtown Rio. The event closed around 21:00 p.m. There is no audience estimate.
Anti-Bolsonaro demonstrators gather in downtown Rio — Photo: Reproduction/GloboNews
Protest against Bolsonaro occupies Cinelândia, in the center of Rio — Photo: TV Globo
Bolsonaro's supporters were concentrated on Avenida Atlântica, in Copacabana, South Zone of Rio, at the height of Post 5. The Military Police followed the demonstration.
At 18:50, the Rio Operations Center reported that the runways, which had been occupied since 14:00 by the demonstrators, were released.
In Rio, supporters of Jair Bolsonaro gathered at Copacabana Beach, in the South Zone — Photo: G1
! [Pro-Bolsonaro demonstrations take place in 16 states Pro-Bolsonaro demonstrations take place in 16 states] (https://s04.video.glbimg.com/x240/7054319.jpg)
Demonstrations in favor of Bolsonaro take place in 16 states
São Paulo
In São Paulo, the demonstrators began to gather in Largo da Batata, in the West Zone, around 14:30 for the “Women against Bolsonaro” event.
The event was also supported by left-wing parties and movements. Artists performed in a sound truck, and stalls sold t-shirts with the hashtag #EleNão.
Anti-Bolsonaro demonstrators walk along Avenida Rebouças in São Paulo — Photo: Nacho Doce/Reuters
The expression was also on flags accompanied by slogans such as “dictatorship never again”, against sexism, racism, and exploitation.
Around 6:00 p.m., the group started hiking. The runway on Avenida Rebouças, in the direction of Paulista, was even completely closed.
The demonstrators arrived at Avenida Paulista shortly before 8 pm and around 20:40 the organizers declared the end of the event and called for the public to disperse peacefully.
The organizers estimate that the event brought together 500 thousand people. The Military Police says it will not estimate the number of people participating.
Aerial photo shows demonstration against candidate Jair Bolsonaro in Largo da Batata, in the West Zone of São Paulo — Photo: Miguel Schincariol/AFP
Anti-Jair Bolsonaro demonstrators gathered in Largo da Batata, in São Paulo — Photo: Roney Domingos/ G1
The São Paulo demonstrators in favor of the PSL candidate began to gather around 10 am in front of the Pacaembu Stadium, in the West Zone of São Paulo. They planned to take a motorcade through the North Zone and reach Ibirapuera Park, in the South Zone. There was no estimate of participants.
Protests in the morning and abroad
During the morning, demonstrations against and in favor of the candidate took place in 40 cities in 12 Brazilian states.
Abroad, cities, such as New York, London, Lisbon, Barcelona, and Mexico City, also had demonstrations against Jair Bolsonaro, in greater or lesser proportion.
Where were there demonstrations
See below how the acts were carried out by the Brazilian states this afternoon:
ACRE
- RIO BRANCO
In favor of Bolsonaro: The event began at 16:17 local time (19:17 Brasília time) at the entrance to the University neighborhood and continued through the streets of the capital to the Arena da Floresta. There is no estimate of the number of participants.
Against Bolsonaro: The act took place during the afternoon on the Maternity Channel, in front of the Rio Branco Urban Terminal. The event began at 16:20 local time (18:20 Brasília time). The organization estimated an audience of one thousand people, and the Military Police says that there are 500 to 800 people present at the event. The demonstration ended at 19:00 Acre time (21:00 Brasília time).
ALAGOAS
- MACEIÓ
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstration brought together thousands of people on the Maceió waterfront. Independent people and members of political, social and trade union movements with banners and posters began a walk at 16:00 from Praça Gogó da Ema, in Ponta Verde, to Post 7, in Jatiúca. The movement's organization says that 20,000 people are participating in the event. The Military Police did not release an estimate of participants.
M Protesters against Jair Bolsonaro gather on the Ponta Verde waterfront, in Maceió (AL). — Photo: Derek Gustavo/G1
AMAPÁ
- MACAPA
In favor of Bolsonaro: The event began at 16:00 at Praça Parque do Forte, in the central region. The organization did not estimate the number of participants. The Military Police, on the other hand, estimated that a thousand people attended the event.
Against Bolsonaro: The rally took place at 16:00 in Floriano Peixoto Square, in the city center. The organization says that 2,000 people attended the event. According to the Military Police, there were 1,500 demonstrators.
AMAZONAS
- MANAUS
Against Bolsonaro: The event began at 16:00 in Largo São Sebastião, in downtown Manaus. According to the organization, 3,000 people attended the demonstration. The Military Police did not release an estimate.
BAHIA
- SALVADOR
Against Bolsonaro: The act of the “Women United against Bolsonaro” movement began at 14:30 and began to disperse at 18:30. The group focused on Campo Grande Square, in the center of the city, and took a walk along the Victory Corridor, bound for the Barra Lighthouse. Organizers said that 10,000 people attended the event. According to the Military Police, the demonstration has about 5 thousand people.
- BARRIERS
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstration began at 17:00 at Praça do Coreto, in the Historic Center. The “All Against Hate” event was organized by university students and the city's population. The Military Police and the organizers did not disclose the number of participants.
CEARÁ
- STRENGTH
Against Bolsonaro: People started to concentrate around 15:00 and went hiking at 16:30. The organization estimates that 50,000 people participated in the event. According to the Military Police, 12,000 demonstrators were at the scene.
Demonstrators against candidate Jair Bolsonaro in Fortaleza (CE) — Photo: Kilvia Muniz/Sistema Verdes Mares
- SOBRAL
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstrators held an act until the beginning of the afternoon. The group toured the main streets of the Center, from the Plaza de la Coluna da Hora to the Plaza de Cuba.
- JUAZEIRO DO NORTE
Against Bolsonaro: The act took place during the afternoon at Praça do Giradouro, which provides access to two other important cities in the south of Ceará, Crato and Barbalha. The organizers estimated the presence of 3,000 people. The Military Police did not release an audience survey.
FEDERAL DISTRICT
- BRASILIA
Against Bolsonaro: The rally on the lawn of the Esplanada dos Ministério, in front of the Plano Piloto bus station, began around 14:30pm. Women spoke in an electric trio and set out on a hike at 15:30 to Funarte, passing through the TV Tower. The Military Police reports that there are 7,000 demonstrators. The organization has yet to release an estimate.
Demonstrators protest against candidate Jair Bolsonaro during an event at the Monumental Axis in Brasilia — Photo: Sérgio Lima/AFP
ESPÍRITO SANTO
- VICTORY
Against Bolsonaro: The concentration of the demonstrators began at 14:00 in the Pope's Square in Vitória. The participants marched towards the Plaza of Wishes. The organization has not yet announced the number of demonstrators. The Military Police reported, at 16:20pm, that there are 2,000 people at the scene.
Anti-Jair Bolsonaro demonstrators gather at Pope's Square in Vitória (ES) — Photo: Leandro Tedesco/ TV Gazeta
- CARIACICA
In favor of Bolsonaro: A march left the Kléber Andrade stadium, in Cariacica, Grande Vitória, at 14:45 this Saturday. The group went on to Campo Grande, where it arrived around 15:40 p.m. The organization did not say the number of participants. The PM also failed to send an estimate.
Motorcade of Jair Bolsonaro supporters in Cariacica, Grande Vitória (ES). — Photo: Leandro Tedesco/TV Gazeta
GOIÁS
- CATALAN
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstrators gathered at Marca Tempo Square, in the city center, at 15:00. The event ended around 16:30 at Getúlio Vargas Square, also in the central region. The organization estimates that a thousand people attended the event.
- JATAÍ
Against Bolsonaro: The event began at 12:30 in Praça Tenente Diomar Menezes, in the city center. According to the organization, 300 people attended the demonstration.
- ANNAPOLIS
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstration began at 16:00 in the Praça do Ancião, in the city center. The protest took place until around 19:00 in Ipiranga Park. There is no estimate of the number of demonstrators.
MARANHÃO
- SÃO LUÍS
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstrators gathered in downtown São Luís, on Avenida Beira-Mar. The organization says 15,000 people attended the event. The Military Police announced that there were 4,000 demonstrators.
MATO GROSSO
- CUIABA
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstration was concentrated at Praça Ulisses Guimarães, on Avenida Historiador Rubens de Mendonça (CPA), in Cuiabá. Independent people and members of social, trade union, and political movements with banners and posters gathered at 16:00 p.m. Even with heavy rain, the group remained on site. The Military Police followed the protest from afar but did not send an estimate of the number of participants. The organization of the movement  There were more than a thousand people at the demonstration.
MATO GROSSO DO SUL
- LARGE FIELD
Against Bolsonaro: The event began at 15:00 at Praça Cuiabá, in the city center. The organization estimates that 4,000 people participated in the event. The Military Police did not release an estimate. The demonstration ended around 8 p.m.
- CORUMBÁ
In favor of Bolsonaro: A motorcade took place around 17:00 on Rua Porto Carreiro, in the central region of the city. The Military Police estimates that 15,000 people participated in the motorcade. The organization didn't release an estimate.
- GOLDEN
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstrators gathered at the Antonio João Square, in the city center, from 15:30 to 16:00. According to the organization, there were 1,500 participants. The Military Police did not release an estimate.
MINAS GERAIS
- BELO HORIZONTE
Against Bolsonaro: The event began around 14:00 at Praça Sete, in downtown Belo Horizonte. Demonstrators gathered at the monument called Pirulito, closing the intersection of Afonso Pena and Amazonas Avenues. Then they went to Praça da Estação, accompanied by an electric trio. The event continued on site until 6:30 p.m. The Military Police did not release an estimate of participants. The Frente Brasil Popular Minas reported that it was leading the organization of the event with another 25 carnival blocks and 40 organizations, such as collectives, unions, and parties. According to the Frente Brasil Popular Minas, the protest brought together more than 100,000 people.
Protesters against candidate Jair Bolsonaro gather at Praça Sete, downtown Belo Horizonte (MG) — Photo: Playback/TV Globo
- DIVINOPOLIS
In favor of Bolsonaro: The motorcade ended around 14:00 after passing through the Manoel Valinhas neighborhoods, Niterói, Avenida Primeiro de Junho (center) and Rua Goiás. The event ended at Bible Square, in the São José neighborhood. According to the organization, there were 500 vehicles. The Military Police did not release an estimate.
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstrators left the Sanctuary Square, in the central region, and walked down Rua São Paulo, towards Avenida Primeiro de Junho. The group then returned to the square. The event ended around 17:00 at Sanctuary Square. The organization says 300 to 400 people attended the event.
- JUIZ DE FORA
Against Bolsonaro: Demonstrators have been gathering at Halfeld Park, in the center, since 11 a.m. Then, they followed several streets in the city center and went to Praça Antônio Carlos. The organization estimates that 30,000 people participated in the event. The Military Police did not provide numbers.
Anti-Bolsonaro demonstrators gather in downtown Juiz de Fora (MG) — Photo: Mônica Cury
- THREE-POINTED
In favor of Bolsonaro: There was a motorcade leaving Cônego Vitor Square around noon. The cars drove through central streets. The motorcade ended around 2 p.m. There is no estimated number of participants.
- UBERLÂNDIA
Against Bolsonaro: The event began at 14:00 at Tubal Vilela Square, in the center. The demonstration was expected to end around 16:00 after a march. There is no estimated number of participants.
PARÁ
- AMETETUBA
Against Bolsonaro: The rally took place at 16:30 in Praça do Barco. The organization says 700 people attended the event. The Military Police did not release an estimate.
- ALTAMIRA
In favor of Bolsonaro: The 'honking' through the city center took place around 16:00 and ended at 18:00. The organization says that 300 people attended the event. The Military Police did not release an estimate.
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstrators gathered in front of the UFPA campus from 16:30 to 19:00. The organization states that 500 people attended the event. The Military Police did not release an estimate.
- BELEM
In favor of Bolsonaro: There was a motorcade departing from Icoaraci, but the organization did not indicate the route. The event began at 17:00. There is no estimated number of participants.
Against Bolsonaro: The rally took place at 16:00 at the São Brás Market. People took a hike to the Davi Miguel Amazon Culture Village, in the Pedreira neighborhood. The organization reported that 15,000 people are participating in the demonstration. The Military Police did not release an estimate.
- ITAITUBE
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstrators gathered at 17:00 at the Orla de Itaituba. The event was expected to end at 21:30pm. There is no estimated number of participants.
- MARABÁ
Against Bolsonaro: The event began at 17:00 in the City Hall Square with a walk scheduled to the Pátio Marabá Shopping Center. A thousand people attend the demonstration, according to the organization. The Military Police did not release an estimate.
- SANTARÉM
In favor of Bolsonaro: Supporters of the presidential candidate gathered at 17:00 at the Silas Brum Cultural Biblical Events Square. There is no estimated number of participants.
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstration began at 17:00 at Praça Monsignor José Gregário (Praça da Matriz). People must still walk along the city's waterfront during the protest. There is no estimated number of participants.
- TUCURUI
Against Bolsonaro: The event began at 17:30 in Rotary Square. The demonstration was expected to end at 21:30pm. The organization says that 300  people attended the event. The Military Police did not release an estimate.
PARANÁ
- CURITIBA
Against Bolsonaro: The rally took place around 16:00 in the central region, near the Boca Maldita Confectionery. The event ended at Santos Andrade Square around 19:30 p.m. There were about 50,000 people, according to the organization. The Military Police estimated 5,000 demonstrators.
- MARINGA
In favor of Bolsonaro: The demonstration began at 13:00 in Salgado Filho Square and ended at 17:00 in Cathedral Square. There is no audience estimate.
Against Bolsonaro: The event began at 14:00 in Renato Celidônia Square, next to the city hall. According to the organization, 4,000 demonstrators were at the scene. The Military Police did not release an estimate.
PARAÍBA
- JOÃO PESSOA
In favor of Bolsonaro: The event began around 16:00 at Independence Square, in the João Pessoa Center, and ended around 17:30. By 8:30 p.m., the organization and the Military Police had not released an estimated number of participants.
Against Bolsonaro: The rally took place in Peace Square, in the banking district. The event started at 15:00 and ended around 20:00. According to the organization, it is estimated that 20 thousand people participated. The Military Police did not release an estimate.
- DUCKS
In favor of Bolsonaro: The rally began at 17:00 and, around 18:00, a motorcade left the Bivar Olinto neighborhood towards Terreiro do Forró, located in the Brasília neighborhood. A section of the BR-361 was banned. Until 18:30, an estimated number of participants had not been released and by 20:20 the group was concentrated in Terreiro do Forró.
PERNAMBUCO
- CARUARU
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstrators gathered starting at 14:00 in front of the INSS. The event is expected to end around 17:30 at the city's Ground Zero. The Military Police reported that the demonstration brought together 700 people.
- REEF
Against Bolsonaro: The rally in Derby Square, in the center of the capital, began at 14:00. The march against Bolsonaro began at 16:00 p.m. The event closed around 18:50 at Independence Square, in the neighborhood of Santo Antônio, in the central area of Recife. The number of demonstrators is estimated at 20,000 people, according to the event's organization. The Pernambuco Military Police does not provide an estimate of the number of people attending events.
Demonstrators march in downtown Recife (PE) against Bolsonaro. — Photo: Marina Meireles/G1
PIAUÍ
- TERESINA
In favor of Bolsonaro: The event in favor of the presidential candidate also began at 16:00 on Avenida Marechal Castelo Branco, North Zone of Teresina. The demonstrators made a motorcade passing through neighborhoods in the region. The organization believes that at least 500 vehicles, including cars and motorcycles, participated.
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstrators gathered at Praça da Liberdade, in the center of the capital, at 16:00 and walked down Avenida Frei Serafim to Francisco das Chagas Júnior Square. According to the organization, 5,000 people attended the march. The demonstration closed at 19:00 followed by performances by local artists.
RIO GRANDE DO NORTE
- CHRISTMAS
Against Bolsonaro: The protest began around 15:00 at the intersection of Bernardo Vieira and Salgado Filho avenues. The nearby intersections were closed by the Municipal Traffic Department. The protest ended around 6 p.m. According to the organizers, there were 10,000 people. The Military Police did not release an estimate of participants.
RIO GRANDE DO SUL
- CAXIAS DO SUL
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstration took place at Flag Square around 15:00. There is no estimated number of participants.
- ERECHIM
In favor of Bolsonaro: Drivers took part in a motorcade. Then there was a concentration of demonstrators in the square in front of the Erechim city hall. The Erechim Military Brigade reported that 5,000 vehicles were in the motorcade in favor of Bolsonaro. The organization did not release an estimate of participants.
- PORTO ALEGRE
Against Bolsonaro: The #EleNão demonstration takes place this Saturday afternoon (29) at Redenção Park, in Porto Alegre. The event has the presence of candidates and is peaceful so far. The Military Brigade did not disclose the number of people at the event. The organization reported that 20,000 people attended the event.
- TAKE A DEEP STEP
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstration began at 3 p.m. People walked along the city's main avenue to the so-called democratic corner in the center. The Military Brigade stated that there were about 100 people, but on Monday (1st) it raised the estimate to 1,000 participants. The organization says the event brought together 2,000 people.
- BALLS
Against Bolsonaro: An act against the presidential candidate has taken place near the Pelotas Public Market since 16:00. There is no estimated number of participants.
- SAINT MARY
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstration took place at Praça Saldanha Marinho around 14:00. There is no estimated number of participants.
- URUGUAYAN
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstrators left Avenida Presidente Vargas, which is the city's main avenue, and walked to the city center, in Praça do Barão.  The protest began at 4 pm and ended at 6 pm. There is no estimate of the number of participants.
RIO DE JANEIRO
- CABO FRIO
Against Bolsonaro: The event began at 15:00 at Praça Porto Rocha. In the city, the demonstration was called the “Regional Act Against Fascism”. According to the organization, 5 thousand people attended the event.
- CAMPOS DE GOYTACAZES
In favor of Bolsonaro: The demonstrators gathered during the afternoon at Praça da Igreja do Saco, on the corner of BR-101 and Alberto Torres. According to the event organization, around 200 people are at the venue.
Against Bolsonaro: The act against the presidential candidate took people to São Salvador Square, in the center of the city. There are about 400 people, according to organizers.
- MACAÉ
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstration began at 13:00 with approximately 60 people at Praça Veríssimo de Melo, in the center.
- NOVA FRIBURGO
Against Bolsonaro: Demonstrators took part in the “Women against Fascism” protest, which began around 15:00 p.m. The demonstrators gathered at Dermeval Barbosa Moreira Square, in the city center. Then they continued walking to the city hall. Traffic on Avenida Alberto Braune, the main avenue in the center, was in half a lane. There is no estimate of the number of participants.
- PETRÓPOLIS:
Against Bolsonaro: The “Women Against Bolsonaro” demonstration began at 17:00 in Dom Pedro Square, in the city center. The demonstrators, mostly women, used banners and posters. There was also a sound car. There is still no audience estimate.
- OYSTER RIVER
In favor of Bolsonaro: The motorcade started at 14:00 in front of the Áncora Neighborhood Citizenship Center. Approximately 300 vehicles participated in the motorcade.
Against Bolsonaro: The event began at 11 am at Praça José Pereira Câmara. Approximately 50 people attended the protest.
RONDÔNIA
- PORTO VELHO
Against Bolsonaro: The #EleNão movement started around 15:00 and is scheduled to close at 18:00. The demonstrators are concentrated in the Alternative Space, a place devoid of physical activities. According to the Military Police, there are 500 people at the scene.
RORAIMA
- BOA VISTA
Against Bolsonaro: The act of the #EleNão movement was concentrated at 16:00 with cultural presentations and the preparation of posters. The protest is expected to end at 8 p.m. According to the organization, 500 people did not participate in the event.
SANTA CATARINA
- BLUMENAU
In favor of Bolsonaro: Bolsonaro's supporters staged a motorcade, which started in the neighboring municipality of Gaspar and reached Blumenau. The Military Police estimates that 460 cars and a thousand people participated in the event.
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstrators began their walk at Dr. Blumenau Square and continued on XV de Novembro Street. The Military Police reports that 150 people participated in the event.
- CHAPECO
Against Bolsonaro: the protest took place in the central region, on Avenida Getúlio Vargas, from 15:00 to 17:30. The Military Police did not disclose the number of demonstrators, but the organization estimates it at 2,000 people.
- FLORIANOPOLIS
Against Bolsonaro: In the capital, the concentration of anti-Bolsonaro demonstrators was in Largo da Catedral. Then they marched along Avenida Beira-Mar Norte. According to the organization, 30,000 people attended the event. For the PM, there were 10,000.
- JOINVILLE
In favor of Bolsonaro: Bolsonaro's supporters gathered in the city's central region. When the group met with anti-Bolsonaro demonstrators, there were provocations and a start of fighting. Against Bolsonaro: The demonstrators left the central region of the city. According to the organization, there were 2,500 people. When the group met with anti-Bolsonaro demonstrators, there were provocations and a start of fighting. The Military Police even intervened and did not release an estimate of participants. The event took place from 15:00 to 18:30.

SERGIPE
- ARACAJU
Against Bolsonaro: The rally began at 15:00 on Avenida Adélia Franco, in the Jardins neighborhood. According to the organization, 5 thousand people are participating in the demonstration. The Military Police did not release an estimate.
SÃO PAULO
- ARARAQUARA
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstrators toured São Bento, Portugal and Nove de Julho streets and ended the event at Praça Santa Cruz. According to the organization, the demonstration brought together 1,500 people. The Military Police reports that there were a thousand participants.
- BAURU
Against Bolsonaro: The demonstration gathered around 14:00 at Praça Rui Barbosa. Then, the demonstrators marched to the Railway Station along the Calçadão da Batista de Carvalho and then returned to Praça Rui Barbosa. The event ended around 17:30 p.m. There is no estimate the number of participants.
- IBITINGA
Against Bolsonaro: The rally of the protest began around 15:00 in João Abraão Square, where demonstrators stayed until 17:00. According to the organization, 150 people participated in the event. The Military Police reports that there were 50 demonstrators.
- MOGI DAS CRUZES
Against Bolsonaro: The act began at 15:30 in Largo do Rosário, in the center of the city, and ended at 17:45 in Largo do Bom Jesus. The organization estimates that 1.8 thousand people attended the event. The Military Police reports that there were 200 participants.

In favor of Bolsonaro: The motorcade started around 15:00 on Avenida Egisto Franceschi, in the Alto da Colina neighborhood. During the event, people followed other streets in the neighborhood. The Military Police says that 25 trucks, 300 cars, and 100 motorcycles are participating in the motorcade.
- JAGUARIUNA
In favor of Bolsonaro: A motorcade started around 12:30 on Rua Amazonas. The event was attended by at least a thousand drivers, the organization said.
- JUNDIAÍ
Against Bolsonaro: Demonstrators protest against the presidential candidate at Ponte Torta, in the city center. The event began at 16:00 p.m. According to the organizers, around 200 people are taking part in the demonstration.
- LENÇÓIS PAULISTA
Against Bolsonaro: The march began at 14:00 in Praça da Matriz. The demonstrators toured Rua XV de Novembro and Avenida 25 de Janeiro. Then they returned to the square around 17:00 when the event ended.
- LITTLE GOLD
Against Bolsonaro: The event began around 16:00 at Skatistas Square. Afterwards, people marched along Avenida Saldanha Rodrigues. The event ended at 17:30 p.m. According to the organization, 500 people attended the event. The Military Police does not report the number of demonstrators.
- RIBEIRÃO PRETO
Against Bolsonaro: The protest against Bolsonaro began around 11:30am. The event ended around 16:00 on the Esplanada do Theatro Pedro II, in the city center. The organization estimates that 2.2 thousand people are participating in the demonstration.
- RIO CLARO
In favor of Bolsonaro: The motorcade of cars and motorcycles was concentrated on Avenida Presidente Kennedy. She followed streets and avenues to Praça Dalva de Oliveira. The organization says that 2,000 vehicles were in the motorcade. The Military Police did not release an estimate.
- SAINTS
Against Bolsonaro: The event brought together demonstrators at Independence Square in Santos. The organization estimates that 3,000 people are at the demonstration. The Military Police reports that there are a thousand participants.
- SÃO JOSÉ DO RIO PRETO
Against Bolsonaro: The act has taken place in front of the São José do Rio Preto City Hall, on Avenida Alberto Andaló, since 16:00. The group will also walk past the Municipal Market on Rua 15 de Novembro and go to the Nelson Castro Amphitheater, on Avenida Duque de Caxias, where a collective and symbolic hug will be held.
- SOROCABA
Against Bolsonaro: The rally began at 15:00 in Coronel Fernando Prestes Square, in the city center. The group then went around the block (streets of Penha, Monsignor João Soares and Braguinha) shouting “not him”. There is no estimated number of participants.
- SUZANO
In favor of Bolsonaro: The rally began at 14:00 at Praça Cidade das Flores, in the central region. The organization estimates that a thousand people participated in the event. The Military Police announced that the protest had 500 participants.
- TATTOOED
Against Bolsonaro: A demonstration against the presidential candidate is taking place in Praça da Matriz. According to the Municipal Civil Guard (GCM), around 200 people participate in the peaceful act. The organizers have not yet released the audience estimate. People began arriving at the place around 15:00 and marched through the city streets accompanied by an electric trio.
- TAUBATÉ
Against Bolsonaro: People gathered at Praça Santa Terezinha around 3 p.m. There was also a march in the streets near the square. There is no estimated number of participants.
- TUPÃ
In favor of Bolsonaro: The motorcade started at 10:30 on Rua Estados Unidos. Closing next to Athlete's Park, around 13:00 p.m. According to organizers, the manifesto brought together approximately 2,000 cars
TOCANTINS
- ARAGUAINA
In favor of Bolsonaro: The group focused on Avenida Via Lago, one of the city's tourist attractions, and remained focused on the site. The event started around 17:00 and ended around 19:00. According to the PM, 2,000 people were present.

In favor of Bolsonaro: People gathered at Praça dos Girassóis, in the central region, starting at 15:00. The motorcade is expected to follow Avenida Teotônio Segurado, which crosses the city from north to south, and heads towards the Ayrton Senna Gymnasium, in the southern region of Palmas.
Against Bolsonaro: The act began around 16:00 at the Indigenous Peoples Square, from where the demonstrators left for the Legislative Assembly, in Praça dos Girassóis. There is no estimated number of participants.

title: Demonstrations against and in favor of Bolsonaro on Saturday, September 29; PHOTOS
description: Demonstrators opposed to the PSL presidential candidate took to the streets in 114 cities. Supporters of him gathered at 40; see images.
text:
Demonstrators from all states and the Federal District took to the streets in acts against presidential candidate Jair Bolsonaro (PSL) this Saturday (29). Altogether, there were 114 cities with opposing demonstrations.
In response to the movement, Bolsonaro supporters also gathered at events across Brazil to demonstrate support for the presidential candidate. 40 cities in 16 states held acts in favor of Bolsonaro.
See photos of the demonstrations below.
Rio de Janeiro (RJ)

title: Women protest against Bolsonaro in several cities in the country | GZH
author: Estadão Content
description: Slogan #Elenão also mobilizes demonstrators in several cities around the world
text:
! [MIGUEL SCHINCARIOL/AFP MIGUEL SCHINCARIOL/AFP] (http://www.rbsdirect.com.br/imagesrc/24715305.jpg?w=700)
Demonstrators against the candidate Jair Bolsonaro (PSL), the leader in the polls for the intention to vote, protested this Saturday (29) in several cities in Brazil. In Brazil, at least 60 events were scheduled in cities such as Brasília, São Paulo, Rio de Janeiro, Goiânia, Porto Alegre, Vitória, Florianópolis, Belo Horizonte, Salvador, Natal, João Pessoa, Recife, Fortaleza, Aracaju, Palmas, Campo Grande, Manaus, Belém, and Cuiabá.
Porto Alegre
The act against Bolsonaro brought a crowd to Farroupilha Park this Saturday afternoon. Named #EleNão, the movement was led by women, but it also brought together men and children expressing the protest against Bolsonaro on t-shirts, banners, posters, and flags. The public focused on the vicinity of the Expeditionary Monument, but advanced to the Redenção gardens and lawns area, to part of Avenida José Bonifácio and to the access to Rua Santana. The event ended with a walk around the city's central region early in the evening.
São Paulo
In São Paulo, the concentration of demonstrators began in the early afternoon around Largo da Batata. In Rio, hundreds of people gather in Cinelândia, in the city's central area. Many demonstrators, especially women, responded to the organizers' call and wore lilacs.
Rio de Janeiro
In Rio de Janeiro, anti-Bolsonaro demonstrators gathered in Cinelândia, in the city's central region, in the early afternoon. In the late afternoon, the participants marched around the center. The event closed around 9 p.m., according to G1.
! [Tadeu Vilani/RBS Tadeu Vilani Agency/RBS Agency] (http://www.rbsdirect.com.br/imagesrc/24715326.jpg?w=700)
Florianopolis
Several people took to the streets of Florianópolis, Santa Catarina, this Saturday afternoon to protest against Bolsonaro. Thousands of people who gathered in Largo da Catedral passed by Avenida Beira-Mar Norte and closed the demonstration in front of the Center's Integration Terminal.
Brasilia
In Brasilia, demonstrators walk from the Plano Piloto bus station to the TV in Torre. At least 30 thousand people - according to the organizers - participated in the event organized by the collective “Women United against Bolsonaro”. In the last update of the Military Police (PM), the mobilization had 7 thousand people. The protest was peaceful.
Minas Gerais
In Minas Gerais, demonstrations take place at Praça da Sete, the central point of Belo Horizonte. With the right to an electric trio, the mood of the protest was one of Carnival and slogans against the presidential candidate. “Neither weak nor from home, women are out on the street to fight,” said one of the songs. The cries of “not him” were also frequently chanted.
! [Mauro Pimentel/AFP Mauro Pimentel/AFP] (http://www.rbsdirect.com.br/imagesrc/24715287.jpg?w=700)
Even with the organization carried out by women - from security guards to instrumentalists - many men are present at the protest. Flags and stickers of other candidates and politicians were seen at the demonstration. Voters of Fernando Haddad (PT), Ciro Gomes (PDT) and Marina Silva (Network) mixed with supporters of former presidents Lula and Dilma Rousseff.
Mundo
Several cities around the world have also registered acts against Bolsonaro. With the slogan #EleNão — created in a campaign by a Facebook group that brings together 3.8 million women — people organized and protested in cities in Germany, France, Switzerland, Italy, and Portugal.
Switzerland
In Geneva, one of the main cities in Switzerland, people protested outside the headquarters of the United Nations (UN) in Europe. They carried signs with words contrary to the candidate and called for an end to “fascism”.
France
In Paris, France, where the extreme right candidate Marine Le Pen, of the National Front, has gained strength in recent years, at least 250 people organized in the city center to protest against the Brazilian candidate.
Images posted on social media with the hashtag #Elenão also show demonstrations in Milan, Italy. In Barcelona, in Spain, and in Lisbon, in Portugal, there were also protests.
! [Zakaria ABDELKAFI/AFP Zakaria ABDELKAFI/AFP] (http://www.rbsdirect.com.br/imagesrc/24715285.jpg?w=700)
In an interview with the newspaper O Estado de São Paulo, the group's creator, Ludimilla Teixeira, stated that she “only lit a match in the powder keg”. On Friday (28), the singer Madonna posted a message against Bolsonaro and increased the visibility of the movement on social media.
According to the movement's leaders, the #EleNão campaign is to alert the population to Bolsonaro's ideas, considered by the participants to be “fascists and sexists”. The growth of the movement provoked reactions - on the weekend of the 15th and 16th, when it had around 2.5 million participants, the Facebook group even went offline after being hacked No and have the name changed with a favorable reference to the PSL candidate. Women were verbally assaulted and threatened.
Physical violence is also suspected in Rio. One of the group's administrators in the city filed a police report with the Civil Police stating that she was assaulted on Monday night (24) by two unidentified men. The activist stated that she had been threatened on the networks because of political militancy, but said she could not say who the aggressors were. The men took only the victim's cell phone, leaving the remaining belongings.
The mobilization through social networks began to attract attention in mid-September, bringing together more than 300,000 women in a single day. It is a reflection of the rejection of Bolsonaro among female voters - the percentage of women who, in the polls with the intention to vote, say that they would never vote for the Fluminense congressman is higher than that of men.

title: Photo of an act against Jair Bolsonaro in Largo da Batata was not manipulated | GZH
description: Image was attributed to Carnival 2017, but it is from the demonstration this Saturday (29)
text:
! [Miguel SCHINCARIOL/AFP Miguel SCHINCARIOL/AFP] (http://www.rbsdirect.com.br/imagesrc/24716696.jpg?w=700)
Social media posts contest the veracity of the image taken Saturday (29) in Largo da Batata, in São Paulo, by photographer Miguel Schincariol, from the content agency Agence France-Presse (AFP), during a demonstration against presidential candidate Jair Bolsonaro (PSL). The photograph illustrated reports from the newspaper O Estado de São Paulo about the demonstrations in the capital of São Paulo and was also published by GaúchazH.
Bolsonaro supporters accuse the media of using the image that, “in fact”, would be of the 2017 Carnival, when the place received thousands of revelers. One of the publications says that “the photo used to publicize the demonstration in Largo da Batata is nothing more than an image of Carnival”.
On the website of the newspaper O Estado de S. Paulo, the journalist Daniel Bramatti, responsible for the publisher Estadão Verifica — the newspaper's fact-checking service — denied the rumor reaffirmed the veracity of the photograph.
image_caption: Photo of Largo da Batata, showing a demonstration from last Saturday (29), is true Miguel SCHINCARIOL/AFP;  ;Photo of Largo da Batata, showing a demonstration from last Saturday (29), is true Miguel SCHINCARIOL/AFP;Photo of Largo da Batata, showing a demonstration from last Saturday (29), is true Miguel SCHINCARIOL/AFP;

title: It is #FAKE what image of an act against Bolsonaro in Largo da Batata is from the 2017 carnival
description: Publications on the internet use a similar image taken in the same place to say that there was no protest of the same size on Saturday (29). It is possible, however, to notice differences in the current image, such as a building graffiti in the background.
text:
Social media posts state that the images of the protest against presidential candidate Jair Bolsonaro held Saturday (29) in Largo da Batata are from Carnival 2017. That statement is #FAKE.
Photo taken at Largo da Batata depicts a demonstration, not the 2017 carnival. — Photo: Photo G1
One of the posts reads: “The photo used to publicize the demonstration in Largo da Batata is nothing more than an image of carnival!” The caption is on an image from the 2017 carnival shown in an article in the newspaper “O Estado de São Paulo” about the 2017 carnival blocks in Largo da Batata.
See the real picture:
Real image taken Saturday of the anti-Bolsonaro protest in Largo da Batata — Photo: Gabriela Biló/ Estadão Content
See the fake posts:
Post states that images of an act against Bolsonaro are from 2017, but information is #FAKE — Photo: Reproduction/Social networks
Another post, which uses the same image, says: “The photo that is being released by the left to talk about the “success of the movement against Bolsonaro” is actually of a street carnival in São Paulo last year! Learn: the left loves to manipulate the truth to its advantage. Always be suspicious!”
Another post states that the image of the act against Bolsonaro is from 2017, but the information is #FAKE — Photo: Reproduction/Social networks
The photograph taken at the same angle on Saturday (29) by photographer Gabriela Biló shows that the concentration actually took place and the images are different from those recorded in 2017. The two photos are by the same author and were published by the newspaper “O Estado de São Paulo”, which may have led some Internet users to believe that the image was the same.
Comparing the two photos, it is possible to see in the 2018 image that the side of a building in the background is graffiti and with very colorful details in shades of green and blue, while during carnival the building's wall is smooth, in a shade of brown.
In the 2018 image, the colors red, purple and lilac, used by the participants in the act against Bolsonaro, are more present than in the 2017 image.
Compare:
In the 2018 image (tall), the building is graffiti; in the 2017 image, the building was painted brown — Photo: Reproduction
It is also possible to notice a large blue and pink stripe used by demonstrators on the left side of the 2018 photo. This element is not present in the previous year's photo.
The 2017 image features a ferris wheel mounted by a beer brand, a detail that doesn't appear in the 2018 image.
The photographer even posted more photos she clicked at last Saturday's protest on her personal Instagram account. In the post, it is possible to see another angle of the group meeting in the center of São Paulo.

title: Women gather at the Centro de Belo Horizonte against Bolsonaro's candidacy
author: State of Minas; Larissa Ricci
description: The demonstration, which began in Praça Sete, continued to Praça da Estação, in the Hypercenter of the capital of Minas Gerais
text:
The Women Against Bolsonaro movement, which, through the hashtag #EleNão, brought together supporters on social networks in Brazil and around the world, is protesting today (29) on the streets of various cities.
In Belo Horizonte, demonstrators opposed to the candidacy of Jair Bolsonaro (PSL) for the Presidency of the Republic gathered starting at 12:00 in Praça Sete, the center of the capital of Minas Gerais. But it wasn't until around 14:30 that the surrounding streets began to be taken over. The event is supported by the carnival blocks. The demonstration has already arrived at the Station Square.
The movement brings together women of all ages and social classes. In the group, there are many mothers and children who lead an electric trio. The singer Aline Calixto was one of the samba drivers along the way.
! [(photo: Alexandre Guzanshe/EM/D.A Press) (photo: Alexandre Guzanshe/EM/D.A Press)] (https://i.em.com.br/LzxHgMO1b5zf38DSHZW0JWRrPjk=/790x/smart/imgsapp.em.com.br/app/noticia_127983242361/2018/09/29/992852/20180929145617831953e.jpg)
“We don't have a political party. We don't have a preferred candidate. Our vote is against Bolsonaro,” they wrote in one of the banners that stand out from the crowd.
“I'm here because he's sexist, racist, homophobic and doesn't deserve to represent Brazil,” said Nádia Barbosa, 30.
! [Largo da Batata - São PauloAFP Largo da Batata - São PauloAFP] (https://i.em.com.br/FfGUoQ7EfvuxyR7Vh4APrF47h_o=/675x/smart/imgsapp.em.com.br/app/foto_127989356258/2018/09/29/6659/20180929192436913759u.jpg)
Avenida Afonso Pena, in the direction of the bus station, was closed for the demonstration. Amazonas Avenue was also taken over by the protest. The Municipal Guard and the Military Police (PM) follow the act.
According to the PM, no prominent occurrence was registered. Corporation will not release an audience estimate.
! [Demonstration #EleNão in Union Square, in New York, in the United StatesDON EMMERT/AFP Demonstration #EleNão in Union Square, in New York, in the United StatesDON EMMERT/AFP] (https://i.em.com.br/cPwA259KfL8HrjGYl9Fkct-2uWY=/675x/smart/imgsapp.em.com.br/app/foto_127989356258/2018/09/29/6661/20180929211542468969o.jpg)

title: The 10 events that marked the presidential race | GZH
author: Itamar Melo
description: GaúchazH points out the episodes and situations that agitated the electoral period and should define, this Sunday (7/10), the result of the polls
text:
Where did we come from? How did we come to this? What was this campaign? GaúchazH points out below the 10 fundamental facts of the 2018 presidential race, the episodes and situations that marked the electoral period, shaped the performance of the candidates and should define, this Sunday, the result of the polls.
1) The stabbing
! [RAYSA LEITE/AFP RAYSA LEITE/AFP] (http://www.rbsdirect.com.br/imagesrc/24726171.jpg?w=700)
Can a madman, armed with a kitchen knife, determine who will be the president of Brazil? Jair Bolsonaro (PSL) had 22% of the voting intentions when he was stabbed on September 6 during a campaign event in Juiz de Fora (MG). Three days later, it was 26%. Three more, and it was up to 28%. From then on, it would be backwards.
This effect was immediately predicted by analysts: the status of victim would shock part of the electorate. What was not foreseen was how much the stabbing would revolutionize the campaign. What at first appeared to be a superficial injury proved to be serious, leading to two surgeries and three weeks of hospitalization. Brazil began to live with a candidate who advertised from the hospital bed. It seemed like a disadvantage, but it wasn't. Bolsonaro dominated the news and was spared from wearing himself out in debates. Banned from hitting someone with their lives at risk, the opponents lowered their tone. Meanwhile, the Bolsonaristas were selling the false idea that the stabbing came from the PT.
The author, Adelio Bispo, 40, diagnosed with mental problems, announced when he was arrested that he had stabbed him at the behest of God. Flávio Bolsonaro, the candidate's son, presented the opposite version: “God acted and pulled the knife away”.
2) Lula candidate
! [EVARISTO SA/AFP EVARISTO SA/AFP] (http://www.rbsdirect.com.br/imagesrc/24726170.jpg?w=700)
Have you ever imagined a convict in prison running for office, being elected and governing Brazil from his cell? The PT members imagined - or at least pretended. In August, when he had been serving a sentence for four months, former president Lula was chosen by acclamation to be the PT's candidate. Fernando Haddad, former mayor of São Paulo by the party, would be the vice-president.
Truth be told, the voter jumped on board. At the end of August, Lula beat 40% in the polls, twice that of Bolsonaro (PSL). The PT's decision, however, gave the campaign an air of magical realism. There was one candidate that everyone knew was not a candidate. There was an individual pretending to be the vice-president, but that everyone knew he would be the running mate.
And there were electoral polls that, because of that, everyone knew that they didn't want to say anything. Faith in President Lula gained an unexpected boost when the UN Human Rights Committee affirmed and reaffirmed, in August and early September, that the Brazilian State should guarantee the candidacy. The Superior Electoral Court (TSE) declined to know. It barred the participation of the former president.
For the PT members, “election without Lula is a fraud” - but not after September 11, when they began to promote Haddad, the replacement anointed by the chief at the last minute.
3) #EleNão x #EleSim
! [Miguel SCHINCARIOL/AFP Miguel SCHINCARIOL/AFP] (http://www.rbsdirect.com.br/imagesrc/24726188.jpg?w=700)
One of the consequences of the campaign was a women's movement of unprecedented dimensions. It was born on the internet, with the hashtag #EleNão, and ended up in the streets during the biggest mass demonstrations of the electoral period. Multi and suprapartisan, the movement preached a simple idea: no matter their political preference, they should all unite against Bolsonaro, seen as a threat to women's rights. It could be anyone. But not him.
The hashtag began to spread at a time when the candidate stagnated in the polls and when Haddad was rising. On the 29th, it led to events that brought together crowds in dozens of cities in Brazil and also in metropolises around the world. There was an atmosphere of euphoria among Bolsonaro's rivals: women would save the country. The feeling was that, on Monday, the new Ibope survey would mark a turning point in the game.
The cold water bath ensued. Instead of falling, Bolsonaro rose four points. It grew mainly in the female electorate, which said: “He, yes”. The perplexity was general. What will happen? What is the reason for the reverse effect? There's still no explanation. One hypothesis: women took to the streets to warn that Bolsonaro is different from all the others - precisely the reason for the vote of his supporters.
4) End of polarization
Brazil has hundreds of parties, but when the president was elected, an oiled mechanism was working: the dispute was between the PT and the PSDB. It had been like this almost since the dawn of the re-democratization: Fernando Henrique x Lula (1994 and 1998), Lula x José Serra (2002), Lula x Alckmin (2006), Dilma Rousseff x José Serra (2010), Dilma x Aécio Neves (2014).
In 2018, after 24 years, things went wrong. Brazil remained divided between PT and anti-PT members, but the antipetism changed its face: it disbanded the PSDB. Or Candid The Tucano actor, Geraldo Alckmin, spent the entire campaign below 10% of the voting intentions, in fourth position.
Why, if only four years earlier Aécio was the hope of political ethics for half of the electorate, who saw the PT as a den of corruption? Well, the answer also lies in Aécio himself. While still president of the PSDB, he was caught getting a bribe of R$ 2 million.
The involvement of the toucanate in robberies created, among the antipetists, the idea that everyone is the same, everyone is corrupt. The problem was no longer just the PT, it was the parties, the political system. And the only way out would be someone who seemed to come from outside, who despised the parties, the system and, perhaps, democracy itself.
5) Fake news
Lies have always existed, it's true, but fake news is a different phenomenon. On the internet, lies disguised as news gush out to manipulate opinions. It's the principle of the wolf in sheep's clothing: the credibility of journalism is usurped for nefarious purposes.
It had already been announced that, as in the American election that brought Donald Trump to the presidency, the campaign in Brazil would be plagued by this evil. Sadly, it was confirmed. In recent days, network monitoring revealed that the phenomenon had exploded, with reckless manipulations taking place via Facebook and WhatsApp. According to digital media observatories, the most active in this field were Bolsonaro's supporters.
This is a tragic phenomenon, which leads millions of voters detached from reality to the polls to justify their vote based on absurd lies. It's fiction and falsehood deciding the country's future.
In the midst of darkness, traditional media outlets launched initiatives to verify and denounce fake news, called fact checking. How did the handlers react? They once again put on the skin of the lamb. They created fake fact checking.
6) Last minute
! [Rodolfo Buhrer/Folhapress Rodolfo Buhrer/Folhapress] (http://www.rbsdirect.com.br/imagesrc/24726172.jpg?w=700)
After stretching the fiction of his candidacy to the last minute, on September 11, Lula risked the miracle of transubstantiating candidates. He anointed Haddad to his place and proclaimed the dogma: Lula is Haddad, Haddad is Lula. The maneuver, which consisted of accumulating voting intentions and then transferring them to others, was risky. Presented as a candidate in place of chief, Haddad appeared in fifth or sixth place in the polls, in the 4% range. With less than a month left until the election, he was unknown. In the Northeast, Lulism's largest pocket, he was referred to as Adraike, Adauto, Andrade, Alade, Radarde.
Still, transubstantiation worked, at least in the beginning. Once an official candidate, Haddad was overcome with a flurry of votes. In 10 days, it rose to 22%, just six points behind Bolsonaro. In the second round, he beat his opponent: 45% x 39%. The anonymous person who appeared almost out of nowhere appeared as the virtual future president of Brazil.
That impression was shaken at the end of the campaign. After the shooting, the former mayor stalled and, upon becoming better known, inherited the rejection of antipetism. He even failed to win in the second round, according to projections. He comes to voting day with the challenge of showing that there is light on that pole.
7) From the street to the hammocks
Brazilians who had the opportunity to visit another country on election day returned amazed: judging by what they saw on foreign streets, there was no reason to suspect that a vote was in progress. In 2018, Brazil became that type of country. In contrast to the recent past, you barely see flags on windows, electoral cords on corners, and stickers on cars.
It's not that we're contained. It's just that the mobilization migrated from the streets to the networks. It was in the virtual squares of Facebook and WhatsApp that the melee, the flag and the urn took place. Under the appearance of placidity, the whirlwind boiled.
Memes, rumors, and videos on the internet made even what was the main channel for balancing the voter superfluous: election time. In four of the seven elections, whoever had the most time won and, since 1998, the two best-valued candidates have always been in the second round.
That season is over. It was believed that the time champion, Alckmin, at 5:32 seconds, would take off, but he didn't leave his seat. Bolsonaro emerged, with only 8 seconds - 40 times less.
8) Center failure
On January 1, 2019, a man hated by a large part of the population is due to take office as president. Whether Bolsonaro or Haddad, it won't just be a creature that nearly half of the people didn't vote for, but who would never vote for.
The next ruler will be detested, to some extent, because the center failed to offer a strong, viable, and exciting alternative. Of course, the “center” classification is highly debatable. Ciro Gomes (PDT) is on the left, Alckmin is on the right and Marina Silva (Rede) — who has already said she is not from the right, the left, or the center, but to be in the lead — was left behind as always.
What is certain is that the three of them tried to put themselves as a moderate option laring. At first, Ciro seemed well positioned for the role, but he failed to negotiate with the self-styled centrão (DEM, PP, PR, PRB, and SD), who chose Alckmin. The toucan, despite the megacoallion, confirmed the fame of the chuchu popsicle. And Marina repeated the dose: she was the candidate who, the more she campaigns, the less votes she has. In the final stretch, when there was no time left, there was still a mobilization to unite the three around the name of Ciro, on an “Alcirina” plate. New failure.
9) Poverty Campaign
This is the first election for president after the end of corporate funding - and it shows. Candidates were unable to even reach the established ceiling of R$ 70 million. The most expensive campaign, from the PT, was projected at R$ 50 million. Alckmin estimated his at R$ 43 million. Four years ago, Dilma spent R$ 445 million and Aécio, R$ 289 million, in inflation-adjusted amounts.
The campaigns won out in a big way. Mega-productions and marketers are gone by the weight of gold. The new situation of poverty was also conducive to the emergence of the figure of the multimillionaire candidate, with a safe haven to put money out of his own pocket.
João Amôedo (Novo), a declared asset of R$ 425 million, reported that banking with personal resources up to 20% of the expenses, calculated at R$ 7 million — by Friday, however, he had invested a modest R$ 100 thousand. Henrique Meirelles (MDB), owner of R$ 377 million, was more wasteful: he put R$ 45 million into his own campaign. Taking into account the latest polls, which gave him 2% of the electorate, he was spending R$ 17 per vote.
10) Dispute without situation
! [DANIEL TEIXEIRA/ESTADÃO CONTENT DANIEL TEIXEIRA/ESTADÃO CONTENT] (http://www.rbsdirect.com.br/imagesrc/24726173.jpg?w=700)
Since the re-democratization, the campaigns for the Presidency had at the center of the debate the term that was coming to an end. There was a candidate in the situation and those who were trying to accredit themselves by attacking the government. Being in the situation, in general, was the best deal. In seven elections, five were won by the official candidate.
In 2018, the writing changed. No candidate risked posing as Michel Temer's heir, for obvious reasons: he is the most unpopular president in history. And take a good look at it, almost everyone is involved in the current administration. Bolsonaro's PSL was the most loyal to the government in Congress, voting in favor of Planalto's interests more frequently than even the MDB, the president's party. Alckmin, in turn, has eight parties in the coalition out of a total of nine that participate or have participated in the current administration, taking over ministries. Marina and Alvaro Dias (Podemos) were also linked to captions that accepted positions from the ruler nicknamed “vampire”.
The most surprising case is that of Meirelles. In addition to being part of the MDB, the current party, he was finance minister and only left office six months ago. Even so, not only did he deny being a Temer candidate during the campaign, but he also tried to link his name to that of Lula.

title: PM says 25,000 vehicles participated in a pro-Bolsonaro motorcade in Brasilia
author: State of Minas; Estadão Content
description: The pro-Bolsonaro movement was organized into groups on social media. The demonstration began around 9 a.m., with around 200 people. Around 11 o'clock, however, it managed to attract more members
text:
The Military Police of the Federal District reported that around 25,000 vehicles participated in the motorcade for presidential candidate Jair Bolsonaro (PSL) held this Sunday, 39, at the Esplanada dos Ministério. According to the PM, 6 lanes were occupied during the dispersion, with 20 to 30 cars passing per minute per lane.
Asked by the press about this number of participants - since around noon, near the end of the demonstration, the estimate released was 10 thousand to 12 thousand cars -, Major Michello reaffirmed that the final figure took into account three and a half hours of the event. According to him, the countdown began at the beginning of the event, at 9 a.m., and since then cars had arrived and left.
Also when asked about the fact that many drivers were going to other destinations and accidentally got into the motorcade, as there were no blockades or warning about the demonstration, the major reinforced the methodology used by the PM and said that “there were a lot of cars, both on the main and secondary roads”.
! [Motorcade in Brasilia this Sunday morning (photo: Ed Alves/CB/D.A Press) Motorcade in Brasilia this Sunday morning (photo: Ed Alves/CB/D.A Press)] (https://i.em.com.br/HBQRhoT-OKEyrC7sWqgCAc_mc-s=/790x/smart/imgsapp.em.com.br/app/noticia_127983242361/2018/09/30/993033/20180930164221572855u.jpg)
The demonstration began around 9 a.m., with around 200 people. Around 11 o'clock, however, it managed to attract more members and form a large motorcade near the National Congress. About an hour later, the group began to disperse and a small part went to the door of Rede Globo to make a “honk”.
The pro-Bolsonaro movement was organized into groups on social media. The page of one of these groups states that candidate support events have been held routinely on Sundays and will continue until the second round, if any.
This Saturday, the 29th, anti-Bolsonaro demonstrators filled the streets of the capitals, the Federal District, and several cities in the interior of Brazil. Cities from other countries also gathered protests against the candidate, including Lisbon, Paris, and Washington. Under the slogan #EleNão, the campaign was created within a Facebook group that brings together 3.8 million women. The movement's leaders say that the campaign is to alert the population about Bolsonaro's ideas, considered by the participants to be “fascists and sexists”.
! [Largo da Batata - São PauloAFP Largo da Batata - São PauloAFP] (https://i.em.com.br/FfGUoQ7EfvuxyR7Vh4APrF47h_o=/675x/smart/imgsapp.em.com.br/app/foto_127989356258/2018/09/29/6659/20180929192436913759u.jpg)
In addition to that, another group favorable to Bolsonaro is meeting near the Brasilia Aeromodelling Center, in another region of the city. The event includes the participation of district candidates allied to the presidential candidate of the PSL.
Voting intentions
Reserve captain and seven-term federal congressman, Bolsonaro had been leading the recent polls of intent to vote for the first round. On Sunday, for the first time, the candidate appears to be technically tied with the presidential candidate of the PT, Fernando Haddad, according to the results of the MDA Institute survey commissioned by the National Transportation Confederation (CNT).
The survey released this Sunday (30) shows Bolsonaro with 28.2% of the voting intentions and Haddad with 25.2% of the interviewees' preference. The margin of error is 2.2 percentage points higher or lower. Considering this margin, Bolsonaro may have between 26% and 30.4%. Haddad, on the other hand, may have between 23% and 27.4%.
On Saturday, Bolsonaro was discharged from the Albert Einstein Hospital in São Paulo after 22 days of hospitalization. He was the target of a knife attack during a campaign event in Juiz de Fora (MG) on September 6.

title: Retrospective 2018: September in PHOTOS
description: G1 selected the most striking photos of the year; check month by month.
text:
September 2 — People watch the National Museum in Rio de Janeiro being consumed by a large fire. The fire destroyed the collection containing more than 20 million items — Photo: AFP
September 3 — Aerial image shows the National Museum in Rio de Janeiro destroyed after fire — Photo: Mauro Pimentel/AFP
September 4 - The oldest couple in the world, Masao and Miyako Matsumoto, look at the albums in their bedroom in a nursing home in Takamatsu, Kagawa, Japan - Photo: Kwiyeon Ha/Reuters
September 6 — The then presidential candidate Jair Bolsonaro after being stabbed during a campaign event in Juiz de Fora, Minas Gerais — Photo: Raysa Leite/AFP
September 6 — Sparks are seen on a firefighter who worked to combat the fire known locally as 'Delta Fire' in the Shasta-Trinity National Forest, California, USA — Photo: Noah Berger/AP
September 8 — American tennis player Serena Williams shouts at referee Carlos Ramos in the women's final of the US Open in New York against Japan's Naomi Osaka. The American tennis player received a series of warnings from the judge, with whom she argued, broke a racket and lost a game as punishment for her behavior. Naomi Osaka won the match and won the title, becoming the first Japanese athlete to win a Grand Slam title — Photo: Danielle Parhizkaran/Reuters
September 11 — An owl holds a small dead bird in its enclosure, in a park in Essen, Germany — Photo: Martin Meissner/AP
September 17 — U.S. Coast Guard rescue team swimmers Samuel Knoeppel, center, and Randy Haba, lower right, approach the rescue of Willie Schubert in a stranded van in Pollocksville, USA, in the aftermath of Hurricane Florence — Photo: Steve Helber/AP
September 24 — Pope Francis waves to the faithful upon arrival at the Basilica in Aglona, Latvia — Photo: Max Rossi/Reuters
September 25 - Vehicles are seen on an express road, near a toll station, on the way back from an extended holiday in Zhengzhou, Henan province, China - Photo: Reuters
September 25 — Comedian Bill Cosby is escorted from the Montgomery County Courthouse in Eagleview, Pennsylvania (USA), after being sentenced to 3 to 10 years in prison for sexual assault — Photo: Jacqueline Larma/AP
September 25 — Aerial photo shows a demonstration against then-presidential candidate Jair Bolsonaro in Largo da Batata, in the West Zone of São Paulo. The event was called by women from the #elenão movement — Photo: Miguel Schincariol/AFP
September 25 — Students cross a bamboo bridge over a garbage stream that branches off the Ciliwung River in Bogor, Indonesia — Photo: Yulius Satria Wijaya/Antara Photo via Reuters
September 28 — A rooster walks near the body of a member of the Barrio-18 gang in San Pedro Sula, Honduras — Photo: Goran Tomasevic/Reuters
September 30 — People search for objects in the wreckage of houses in a residential area of Palu, Indonesia, after an earthquake and tsunami. Over 1,600 people died — Photo: Darwin Fatir/Antara Photo/via Reuters

title: Demonstrations against Bolsonaro are among the most talked about topics on Twitter
author: State of Minas; Estadão Content
description: The two hottest hashtags on Twitter right now are #ÉPelaVidaDasMulheres and #TodosContraBolsonaro
text:
! [Demonstration #EleNão in Union Square, in New York, in the United StatesDON EMMERT/AFP Demonstration #EleNão in Union Square, in New York, in the United StatesDON EMMERT/AFP] (https://i.em.com.br/cPwA259KfL8HrjGYl9Fkct-2uWY=/675x/smart/imgsapp.em.com.br/app/foto_127989356258/2018/09/29/6661/20180929211542468969o.jpg)
Demonstrations organized by women in various cities in the country against presidential candidate Jair Bolsonaro (PSL) are also gaining space on social networks. Among the ten most commented topics on Twitter Brazil in the last hour, three are directly related to popular demonstrations.
The two hottest hashtags on Twitter right now are #ÉPelaVidaDasMulheres and #TodosContraBolsonaro. The call for the demonstration came from an event on Facebook called Women Against Bolsonaro.
Also among the most talked about terms, in tenth position, is the place in the capital of São Paulo where most of the demonstrators are concentrated: Largo da Batata.
! [Largo da Batata - São PauloAFP Largo da Batata - São PauloAFP] (https://i.em.com.br/FfGUoQ7EfvuxyR7Vh4APrF47h_o=/675x/smart/imgsapp.em.com.br/app/foto_127989356258/2018/09/29/6659/20180929192436913759u.jpg)
